item.title: Zombie Scrum and the agile mindset
item.description: One problem I’ve seen on several occasions now is that of Zombie Scrum, or Scrum-by-numbers. It’s an issue whereby someone has implemented Scrum some time back, and the implementation has stagnated. Symptoms usually include the team doing all the ceremonies correctly, but not yielding the on-going benefits. A lot of practices (especially the daily Scrum) start to feel forced, or lose purpose. (Note, this isn’t limited to Scrum, but Scrum is the one I’m most familiar with.
